summary: This document is an email chain from April 8, 2021, among FBI agents in the New York Field Office, coordinating logistics for FBI agents to assist with the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The agents are scheduled to provide security and monitor Maxwell and her defense team during a three-day evidence review at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse from April 13-15, 2021.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: The federal prosecutor who will be present all three days of the evidence review at 500 Pearl Street and will meet the agents there.

persons.name: SOS
persons.role: FBI Special Agent or Support Staff
persons.context: An individual (likely an FBI agent or support staff) who is familiar with the Maxwell case and will be present all three days; agents are encouraged to reach out to her.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the case. She and her defense team will be reviewing evidence at 500 Pearl Street under FBI supervision. She will be produced by the Marshals each morning.

connections.description: FBI colleagues coordinating logistics for the Maxwell evidence review; SA responds to N.'s email about scheduling.
N. informs agents that the AUSA will be present and involved in the evidence review process, indicating a working relationship between the FBI and the prosecution.
FBI agents are assigned to monitor Maxwell, escort her, and maintain custody during the evidence review, requiring them to have a handcuff key.
The AUSA is the prosecutor in the case against Maxwell and will be present during her defense team's evidence review.

events.title: Start of Maxwell Evidence Review
events.description: First day of a scheduled three-day evidence review at 500 Pearl Street courthouse where Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team, under FBI supervision, will review case evidence.

events.title: Three-Day Evidence Review Session
events.description: A multi-day review of evidence in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, taking place from 9:00 AM to approximately 4:30 PM each day at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse, with FBI agents providing security and monitoring.

locations: 5th floor, proffer room area (500 Pearl Street courthouse)
keyFacts: In April 2021, Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team was scheduled to review evidence in her case over three days (April 13-15) at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse in New York.
The FBI's New York Field Office, specifically Squad C-20, was tasked with providing agents to secure the event, monitor Maxwell, and ensure the safe handling of evidence.
The logistics required at least one FBI agent with a handcuff key to be responsible for pulling Maxwell from the Marshal cellblock and escorting her, including to the bathroom.
The evidence unit was responsible for transporting all evidence to and from 500 Pearl Street, and FBI agents were not required to handle evidence transportation.
An Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) was scheduled to be present all three days, indicating the prosecution's oversight of the defense's evidence review process.
